DefiningCitation: D. K. (1964) The neuronal structure of the medial geniculate body of the cat.  J. Anat.
Thalamus geniculate nucleus (medial) pri.Definition: Principle neuron in ventral division of medial geniculate nucleu characterized by strongly tufted dendrites, with overall discoid dendritic fields extending dors-ventrally and antero-posteriorly on average of 200 um.  Neurons are arranged in parallel laminae, seen in transverse or horizontal sections of the pars lateralis.  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC1261345/?page
